p:
Dienes can combine with oxygen to form a peroxyl radical (LOO •) creating hydroperoxides (LOOH) and other radicals, thus propagating the reaction (autoxidation). Hydroperoxides can eventually split into alkoxy radicals (LO •) and hydroxy radicals ( •OH), generally considered primary products of lipid peroxidation. This chain of reaction can be schematized as follows: LH → L • + •H
L •+ O 2 → LOO •
LOO • + LH → LOOH + L •
LOOH → LO • + •OH
